list.title: Publish#connect
list.description:
Starts broadcast to an existing stream name.

In the example, getYourMediaStream and getYourPublisherConnection is your own implementation.

list.title: Publish#record
list.description: Initialize recording in an active stream and change the current record option.

list.title: Publish#sendMetadata
list.description: Send SEI user unregistered data as part of the frame being streamed. Only available for H.264 codec.

list.title: Publish#unrecord
list.description: Finalize recording in an active stream and change the current record option.

list.description: SEI Pic timing time code

list.title: Signaling#close
list.description: Close WebSocket connection with Millicast server.

list.title: Signaling#cmd
list.description: Send command to the server.

list.title: Signaling#connect
list.description: Starts a WebSocket connection with signaling server.

list.title: Signaling#event:broadcastEvent
list.description:
Passthrough of available Millicast broadcast events.

Active - Fires when the live stream is, or has started broadcasting.

Inactive - Fires when the stream has stopped broadcasting, but is still available.

Stopped - Fires when the stream has stopped for a given reason.

Vad - Fires when using multiplexed tracks for audio.

Layers - Fires when there is an update of the state of the layers in a stream (when broadcasting with simulcast).

Migrate - Fires when the server is having problems, is shutting down or when viewers need to move for load balancing purposes.

Viewercount - Fires when the viewer count changes.

Updated - when an active stream's tracks are updated

More information here: {@link https://docs.dolby.io/streaming-apis/docs/web#broadcast-events}

list.title: Signaling#event:wsConnectionClose
list.description: WebSocket connection with signaling server was successfully closed.

list.title: Signaling#event:wsConnectionError
list.description: WebSocket connection failed with signaling server. Returns url of WebSocket

list.title: Signaling#event:wsConnectionSuccess
list.description: WebSocket connection was successfully established with signaling server.

list.description: Establish WebRTC connection with Millicast Server as Publisher role.

list.title: Signaling#subscribe
list.description: Establish WebRTC connection with Millicast Server as Subscriber role.

list.description: Configure DRM protected stream. When there are {@link EncryptionParameters} in the payload of 'active' broadcast event, this method should be called

list.description:
Connects to an active stream as subscriber.

In the example, addStreamToYourVideoTag and getYourSubscriberConnectionPath is your own implementation.

list.description: Start projecting source in selected media ids.

list.description: Emits peer events.

list.title: extractH26xMetadata
list.description: Extract user unregistered metadata from H26x Encoded Frame

list.title: loggerHandler
list.description: Callback which handles log messages.

list.title: module:Director
list.description:
Simplify API calls to find the best server and region to publish and subscribe to. For security reasons all calls will return a JWT token for authentication including the required socket path to connect with.

You will need your own Publishing token and Stream name, please refer to Managing Your Tokens.

list.title: module:Director~getEndpoint
list.description: Get current Director API endpoint where requests will be sent. Default endpoint is 'https://director.millicast.com'.

list.title: module:Director~getLiveDomain
list.description: Get current Websocket Live domain. By default is empty which corresponds to not parse the Director response.

list.title: module:Director~getPublisher
list.description: Get publisher connection data.

list.title: module:Director~getSubscriber
list.description: Get subscriber connection data.

list.title: module:Director~setEndpoint
list.description: Set Director API endpoint where requests will be sent.

list.title: module:Director~setLiveDomain
list.description: Set Websocket Live domain from Director API response. If it is set to empty, it will not parse the response.

list.title: module:Logger
list.description:
Manages all log messages from SDK modules, you can use this logger to add your custom messages and set your custom log handlers to forward all messages to your own monitoring system.

By default all loggers are set in level OFF (Logger.OFF), and there are available the following log levels.

This module is based on js-logger you can refer to its documentation or following our examples.

list.title: module:Logger~DEBUG
list.description: Logger.DEBUG

list.title: module:Logger~ERROR
list.description: Logger.ERROR

list.title: module:Logger~INFO
list.description: Logger.INFO

list.title: module:Logger~OFF
list.description: Logger.OFF

list.title: module:Logger~TIME
list.description: Logger.TIME

list.title: module:Logger~TRACE
list.description: Logger.TRACE

list.title: module:Logger~VERSION
list.description: Returns the current SDK version.

list.title: module:Logger~WARN
list.description: Logger.WARN

list.title: module:Logger~diagnose
list.description: Returns diagnostics information about the connection and environment, formatted according to the specified parameters.

list.title: module:Logger~get
list.description: Gets or creates a named logger. Named loggers are used to group log messages that refers to a common context.

list.title: module:Logger~getHistory
list.description: Get all logs generated during a session. All logs are recollected besides the log level selected by the user.

list.title: module:Logger~getHistoryMaxSize
list.description: Get the maximum count of logs preserved during a session.

list.title: module:Logger~getLevel
list.description: Get global current logger level. Also you can get the level of any particular logger.

list.title: module:Logger~setHandler
list.description: Add your custom log handler to Logger at the specified level.

list.title: module:Logger~setHistoryMaxSize
list.description: Set the maximum count of logs to preserve during a session. By default it is set to 10000.

list.title: module:Logger~setLevel
list.description: Set log level to all loggers.

list.title: module:SdpParser
list.description: Simplify SDP parser.

list.title: module:SdpParser~adaptCodecName
list.description: Replace codec name of a SDP.

list.title: module:SdpParser~getAvailableHeaderExtensionIdRange
list.description: Gets all available header extension IDs of the current Session Description.

list.title: module:SdpParser~getAvailablePayloadTypeRange
list.description: Gets all available payload type IDs of the current Session Description.

list.title: module:SdpParser~removeSdpLine
list.description: Remove SDP line.

list.title: module:SdpParser~renegotiate
list.description: Renegotiate remote sdp based on previous description. This function will fill missing m-lines cloning on the remote description by cloning the codec and extensions already negotiated for that media

list.title: module:SdpParser~setAbsoluteCaptureTime
list.description: Mangle SDP for adding absolute capture time header extension.

list.title: module:SdpParser~setDTX
list.description: Set DTX (Discontinuous Transmission) to the connection. Advanced configuration of the opus audio codec that allows for a large reduction in the audio traffic. For example, when a participant is silent, the audio packets won't be transmitted.

list.title: module:SdpParser~setDependencyDescriptor
list.description: Mangle SDP for adding dependency descriptor header extension.

list.title: module:SdpParser~setMultiopus
list.description: Parse SDP for support multiopus. Only available in Google Chrome.

list.title: module:SdpParser~setSimulcast
list.description: Parse SDP for support simulcast. Only available in Chromium based browsers.

list.title: module:SdpParser~setStereo
list.description: Parse SDP for support stereo.

list.title: module:SdpParser~setVideoBitrate
list.description: Parse SDP for desired bitrate.

list.title: module:SdpParser~updateMissingVideoExtensions
list.description: Adds missing extensions of each video section in the localDescription

list.title: parseWebRTCStats
list.description: Parses incoming WebRTC statistics This method takes statistical data from @dolbyio/webrtc-stats and transforms it into a structured format compatible with previous versions.

list.title: tokenGeneratorCallback
list.description: Callback invoke when a new connection path is needed.
